flawed_nl_solution:
The first fisherman will catch 3*213 = <<3*213=639>>639 fish during the season.
The second fisherman catch 1*30 + 2*60 = <<1*30+2*60=510>>510 fish during the first 90 days of the season.
Then, during the remaining 213 - 90 = 123 days of the season, the second fisherman will can an additional 4*123 = <<4*123=492>>492 fish.
Thus, the second fisherman will catch a total of 510 + 492 = <<510+492=1002>>1002 fish.
Therefore, the second fisherman will catch 1002 - 639 = <<1002-639=363>>363 more fish than the first fisherman at the end of the season.

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 150, not 510. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
